name: Swashbuckling and Chivalry Trivia Game | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: The most famous movie of this genre is Errol Flynn's 'Adventures of Robin Hood'. Who played the evil Prince John?
Who played Flynn's nemesis in 'The Adventures of Robin Hood'?
questions.explanation:
Basil Rathbone.

	Good performances by everyone in the movie.

questions.text: 'Ivanhoe' was as good as any swashbuckling movie. Who played the title role?
Who wrote the novel 'Ivanhoe' upon which at least one movie was based?
questions.explanation:
Sir Walter Scott.

	The others also wroted similar adventure tales.

questions.text: Who played Ivanhoe's nemesis in the film 'Ivanhoe'?
questions.explanation:
George Sanders.

	With a young Liz Taylor.

questions.text: Errol Flynn also did 'Captain Blood'. Who was his leading lady?
questions.explanation:
Olivia De Havilland.

	Olivia was his usual co-star in these things.

questions.text: Before he became a buccaneer, what was the eponymous Captain Blood's profession?
questions.explanation:
Doctor.

	He later helped cure the governor's gout.

questions.text: In 'The Prisoner of Zenda', Stewart Granger (in the lead role) is opposed by the evil Rupert of Hentzau. Who played Rupert?
questions.explanation:
James Mason.

	Mason always had style.

questions.text: The plot of 'The Prisoner of Zenda' involves an attempt by the protagonist to:
questions.explanation:
Impersonate a member of royalty.

	Imprisonment is the story line in 'Count of Monte Cristo'. Raising money for ransom comes from 'Ivanhoe'. Opposing an armada comes from Flynn's 'Sea Hawk'.

questions.text: 'The Private Lives of Elizabeth and Essex' featured this famous actress.
questions.explanation:
Bette Davis.

	A young Joan Collins, too.
